Package org.forgerock.openam.test.apidescriptor

Class ApiAnnotationAssert

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.assertj.core.api.AbstractAssert<ApiAnnotationAssert,​Class>
      • org.forgerock.openam.test.apidescriptor.ApiAnnotationAssert
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.assertj.core.api.Assert<ApiAnnotationAssert,​Class>, org.assertj.core.api.Descriptable<ApiAnnotationAssert>, org.assertj.core.api.ExtensionPoints<ApiAnnotationAssert,​Class>
    public final class ApiAnnotationAssert
extends org.assertj.core.api.AbstractAssert<ApiAnnotationAssert,​Class>
    This is the entry test class for API annotated classes. It will assert that a class was correctly annotated and that it conforms to the OpenAM conventions. The convenience method hasValidAnnotations() will do all assertions necessary to validate an annotated class.
    Since:
    14.0.0

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.assertj.core.api.AbstractAssert

        actual, info, myself

        public static ApiAnnotationAssert assertThat​(Class value)

      • classAnnotation

        public ApiProviderAssert classAnnotation()
        Get the test representative of SingletonProviders, CollectionProviders and RequestHandlers in the annotated class.
        Returns:
        The ApiProviderAssert containing the provider annotation.

      • methodAnnotations

        public ApiActionAssert methodAnnotations()
        Get the test representative of Create, Update, Delete, Patch, Action, Query) as a generic Annotation in the annotated class.
        Returns:
        The ApiActionAssert containing the method annotations.

      • hasValidAnnotations

        public void hasValidAnnotations()
        This convenience method will do all assertions necessary to validate that an annotated class was correctly annotated and that it conforms to the OpenAM conventions.
